Dear Katrina Dahl Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1.20.24, Youth A was assaulted by Staff 1. Youth A had
returned to the facility and Staff 1 started yelling at the youth.
While taking off the youth's boots, the staff member threw one at
the youth's face. Other staff intervened. The youth was not injured,
but he did cry.
Investigation This complaint was received on 01/24/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
I interviewed the Complainant via telephone on 01/24/2024. No
additional information was provided.
I interviewed Director at the agency on 01/24/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported on 01/20/2024 Youth A had
a meet and greet with an adoptive family off site. Youth A was
transported to the event by Staff 2. After the meeting, it took Staff 2
over 30 minutes to get Youth A into the vehicle and return to the
campus. When Youth A and Staff 2 came back to campus, Staff 1
was frustrated with Youth A for giving Staff 2 a hard time. Staff 1 and
Youth A started to argue, and this was when Staff 1 threw the boot at
Youth A. Director said Staff 1 has been put on administrative leave
pending the investigation. Director said he will arrange to have Staff 1
come in to be interviewed on 01/26/2024.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 01/24/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported Staff 1 was upset with him
for refusing to get in the vehicle after the adoption meet and greet
2

event. Youth A said when he and Staff 2 entered the cottage, Staff 1
took Youth A’s boots and coat off him and threw one of the boots at
him. Youth A said the boot hit him in the head. Youth A denied being
injured or hurt but said he did cry after the incident. Youth A said Staff
2 and Staff 3 intervened and protected him. Staff 1 left the cottage
after the incident and Youth A has not had any contact with Staff 1
since the incident.
I spoke with Youth A’s Foster Care Worker on 01/25/2024. Foster
Care Worker reported Youth A has been placed at the agency for
over one year. She is not aware that Youth A was injured or hurt
during this incident.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 01/26/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a second shift supervisor and has
been working at the agency for 8 months. Staff 1 admitted he was
very frustrated on 01/20/2024 because he received several calls from
Staff 2 about Youth A refusing to get in the van after the adoption
meet and greet at the bowling alley. Youth A was upset because he
didn’t win a toy. It took Staff 2 over a half hour to get Youth A in the
van. Once in the van, Youth A attempted to get out of the van, and
staff had to call law enforcement to get Youth A back in the van.
Once Youth A and Staff 2 came back to the cottage, he asked Youth
A to give him his coat and boots because he didn’t want Youth A to
AWOL. Staff 1 said he did express his frustration to Youth A about his
behavior and Youth A became more upset and had cursed at Staff 1.
Staff 1 said he threw the boot out of frustration in the direction of
Youth A but didn’t intend to throw the boot at Youth A. Staff 1 walked
out of the cottage after the incident. Staff 1 was very emotional and
acknowledged he overreacted in the situation and should not have
thrown the boot.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the agency on 01/26/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at the agency for
four months. Staff 2 reported he transported Youth A to the adoption
meet and greet on 01/20/2024. After the event Youth A was upset
because he didn’t win a toy and refused to get in the van. It took Staff
2 over a half hour to convince Youth A to get in the van. Youth A was
still upset about not winning a toy, so while stopped at a red-light
Youth A opened the van door and got out of the van. Staff 2 pulled
over and called the police. The police talked to Youth A and
convinced Youth A to get back in the van. Staff 2 had called the
cottage and informed Staff 1 of the incident. When Staff 2 and Youth
A got back to the cottage, Staff 1 took Youth A's coat and boots, so
that Youth A would not attempt to AWOL. Staff 1 and Youth A were
arguing, so Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 attempted to de-escalate the
3

situation by standing in between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 2 said
Youth A and Staff 1 were exchanging words when Staff 1 threw the
boot in the direction of Youth A. Staff 2 didn’t see Youth A get hit with
the boot. Staff 1 left the cottage after the incident and Youth A went to
his room.
I interviewed Youth B at the agency on 01/26/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B is in the same cottage with Youth A.
Youth B denied witnessing Staff 1 throw a boot at Youth A. Youth B
reported feeling safe and didn’t express any concerns regarding Staff
1 or any other staff.
I interviewed Youth C at the agency on 01/26/2024, In collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C is in the same cottage with Youth A.
Youth C recalled on 01/20/2024 after the adoption event, Youth A
was upset and came into the cottage yelling. Youth C was watching
television and didn’t witness the incident. He only recalls hearing
Youth A yelling.
I interviewed Youth D at the agency on 02/01/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth D recalled the incident with Youth A
and Staff 1. Youth D said he heard Youth A and Staff 1 arguing, but
denied witnessing Staff 1 throw a boot at Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the agency on 02/01/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported he was standing in the
cottage entrance talking to Youth A, when Staff 1 came out of his
office and took Youth A’s coat and boots. Staff 3 said Staff 1 was
upset and had yelled at Youth A. Staff 3 and Supervisor 1 tried to talk
to Staff 1 to calm him down and that’s when Staff 1 threw the boot at
Youth A. Staff 3 said he felt that Staff 1 did intend to throw the boot at
Youth A, even though the boot didn’t hit Youth A. Staff 3 talked to
Youth A after the incident and Youth A was not hurt or injured.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the agency on 02/01/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 reported when
Youth A and Staff 2 came into the cottage from the adoption event,
Staff 1 was upset that Youth A had acted out after the event.
Supervisor 1 said he tried to talk to Staff 1, but Staff 1 was very upset
and had yelled at Youth A. Supervisor 1 tried to de-escalate the
situation, but Youth A also started yelling at Staff 1 and that’s when
Staff 1 threw the boot. Supervisor 1 does not think that Staff 1 was
intending to throw the boot at Youth A.
A predisposition conference was held with MDHHS Specialist on
02/22/2024. There is a finding by MDHHS Specialist.
4

Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 01/20/2024 was reviewed on 01/24/2024
(Note: there is no audio). Youth A and Staff 2 were viewed walking
into the cottage. Supervisor 1 appeared to be talking to Youth A in
the entrance leading into the living room area. Staff 1 is also
standing in the entrance and talking to Youth A. Staff 1 took Youth
A’s jacket and boots off him and appeared to be exchanging
words with Youth A. Staff 1 appeared agitated and put his hands
up in the air, walked towards Youth A, then Supervisor 1 stood
between Staff 1 and Youth A. Then Staff 2 walked up to Staff 1
and stood in between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 1 threw the boot
over Staff 2 ‘s shoulders and the boot almost hit Youth A’s head.
Staff 3 came up to Youth A and walked Youth A to the living room
and closed the door. Supervisor 1 blocked the door and Staff 1
walked out of the cottage.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident reported dated 01/20/2024 completed by Staff 2.
Youth A had an adoption meet and greet off campus.
Youth A was upset because he didn’t win a toy. Youth A
refused to get in the vehicle. After 35 minutes, Youth A
gets in the vehicle. While stopped at a red-light, Youth A
exited out of the vehicle. Staff 2 pulled the vehicle over and
called the police. The police spoke to Youth A and
convinced him to get back in the vehicle.
• Methodist Intervention Standards and Prohibitions Policy
(rev. 09/01/21) outlines discipline standards for youth. The
facility prohibits any form of corporal punishment and/or
inappropriate hands-on intervention such as but not limited
to; pinching, spanking, slapping, hitting, twisting arms,
paddling, pulling hair, grabbing, pushing, and threatening
gestures.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 - no disciplinary action.
• Employment termination letter for Staff 1 dated 01/29/2024
for policy violation.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage reviewed, and
documentation, a violation is established regarding staff throwing
a boot at Youth A, which is an inappropriate and prohibited form of
discipline.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C0000726SI dated 08/28/2023; CAP approved
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
